channel.title: Event Handlers :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: In C#, we use event handlers (sometimes called event listeners in other languages) to register the behavior we want to happen in response to specific events. Youâ€™ve probably already used these, i.e. declaring a handler: private void OnEvent(object sender, EventArgs e) { // TODO: Respond to the event }Most event handlers follow the same pattern. They do not have a return value (their return type is void), and take two parameters.
